intro: Keckiella rothrockii subsp. jacintensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to the harsh, alpine environment. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
